bill_profile.bill_title: Birthplace of the National Guard of the United States
bill_profile.bill_summary: Amends title 32, United States Code, the body of Laws of the United States dealing with the National Guard, to recognize the City of Salem, Massachusetts, as the Birthplace of the National Guard of the United States.

bill_profile.bill_title: Unclaimed Money Recovered by Airport Security
bill_profile.bill_summary: Amends title 49, United States Code, to direct the Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security (Transportation Security Administration) to transfer unclaimed money recovered at airport security checkpoints to United Service Organizations, Incorporated, and for other purposes.

bill_profile.bill_title: Compliance With Obligations of Hague Convention
bill_profile.bill_summary: Amends part D of title iv of the Social Security Act to ensure that the United States can comply fully with the obligations of the Hague Convention of 23 November 2007 on the International Recovery of Child Support and Other Forms of Family Maintenance.

To HOUSE Committee on EDUCATION AND THE WORKFORCE.

bill_profile.bill_title: Ownership of Livestock Intended for Slaughter
bill_profile.bill_summary: Amends the Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921 to make it unlawful for a packer to own, feed, or control livestock intended for slaughter.

status_action.action_text: INTRODUCED.
To HOUSE Committee on AGRICULTURE.

bill_profile.bill_summary: Amends title 38, United States Code, to expand the definition of homeless veteran for purposes of benefits under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

status_action.action_text: INTRODUCED.

bill_profile.bill_title: Grants To States to Assist Veterans
bill_profile.bill_summary: Directs the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide grants to States to assist veterans with who were trained to drive large vehicles while serving in the Armed Forces in obtaining, upon their discharge or release from active duty service, State commercial drivers licenses.

To HOUSE Committee on VETERANS' AFFAIRS.
